text: Picture of d'Angelo in Lives of the Artists Francesco d'Angelo (1446–1488), also known as Il Coccia, was a sculptor and engineer in Florence, Italy. He is best known for his sculptures―often mechanical―carried in religious processions, theatrical machinery, and military devices. He was killed in battle in 1488 while accompanying the Florentine army and was buried in Florence at the Church of San Pier Scheraggio (later absorbed into the Uffizi Gallery). ==References== Category:Italian sculptors Category:Italian male sculptors Category:Italian engineers Category:1446 births Category:1488 deaths
title: Francesco d'Angelo
